Whatever the origin, coffee and spirits will make this sweet chilled drink warm you right up this Christmas. It also goes by "cola de mono."

recipes.title: Chimichurri Chicken
recipes.description: Chimichurri chicken is an Argentinian-style dish bursting with herbs and garlic. Serve it as a fast main course that's out of the ordinary.

recipes.title: Chocolate-Covered Matzo
recipes.description: Chocolate-covered matzo is layered with toffee, melted chocolate and a sprinkle of sea salt for a classic Passover dessert. No Passover Seder is complete without it!

recipes.title: Chocolate Rugelach
recipes.description: This chocolate rugelach recipe gives the classic light, flaky and bite-sized pastries a twist with a chocolatey filling. This nuanced and downright delicious dessert would be a wonderful addition to any party.

recipes.title: Coconut Rice
recipes.description: Upgrade your dinner with a side of coconut rice, an easy side dish that brings a dose of tropical flavor to your plate.

recipes.title: Coffee Granita
recipes.description: When you're craving a refreshing frozen treat, a simple coffee granita hits the spot.

recipes.title: Coffee Jelly
recipes.description: Coffee jelly is an elegant three-ingredient dessert for dinner parties or date nights in. This fun Jell-O variation is perfect for coffee lovers.

recipes.title: Copycat Bounty Chocolate Bites
recipes.description: Bounty is a coconut-filled chocolate bar made by Mars. These copycat chocolate bites take that same concept and mold them into bite-sized pieces with one exception: graham crackers! They add a bit of sweetness and texture to the chewy treat.

recipes.title: Creamy Apricot Stuffed Dates
recipes.description: These delightful date bites are ridiculously easy to create. They always hit the sweet spot, whether served as an appetizer or dessert.

recipes.title: Creole Shrimp and Sausage
recipes.description: This Creole shrimp and sausage recipe is hearty, flavorful and on the table in 30 minutes.

recipes.title: Crunchy Cheesy Crisps
recipes.description: I found a recipe in one of my cookbooks, which I've had for quite some time, and tweaked it to make these cracker-like crisps. They go well with any dip or spread.

recipes.title: Cuban Sandwich
recipes.description: This Cuban sandwich isn't your typical sub sandwich. With two kinds of pork, melted Swiss cheese, pickles and mustard pressed between two toasty pieces of bread, the picture-perfect Cubano will have you wanting more.

recipes.title: Cucumber Margarita
recipes.description: This four-ingredient cucumber margarita is cool, refreshing and perfectly balanced. Learn how to upgrade a classic margarita with homemade cucumber juice (no juicer necessary!).

recipes.title: Cumin-Spiced Lentil Burgers
recipes.description: I adapted my Turkish daughter-in-law’s traditional recipe for lentil logs

recipes.title: Earl Grey Tiramisu
recipes.description: Earl Grey tiramisu is a wonderfully unexpected fall dessert, with plenty of floral and citrusy flavor.

recipes.title: Elise Jesse’s Avocado Shrimp Tartlets
recipes.description: This avocado shrimp tartlet is a bold bite-sized appetizer that combines heat with a creamy twist. A smooth blend of ripe avocado, cream cheese and fresh lime juice is whipped to perfection, then piped into crisp golden phyllo shells for a light, buttery base. Each tartlet is crowned with a juicy Cajun seasoning-dusted shrimp, then finished with a spoonful of pico de gallo and a sprinkle of cilantro. It’s rich, zesty and irresistibly flavorful. These are perfect for summer soirées or an elevated appetizer spread!

recipes.title: Elise Jesse’s Philly Cheesesteak Zucchini Boats
recipes.description: If you're craving the bold, savory flavors of a classic Philly cheesesteak but want something a little lighter for summer, these Philly cheesesteak zucchini boats are the answer. I make them with tender slices of NY strip steak and sauteed bell peppers, onions and mushrooms, all tucked into roasted zucchini halves and topped with melted provolone. It's a healthy twist on the sandwich we know and love, without sacrificing flavor. This dish is hearty, satisfying and weeknight-friendly.

recipes.title: Everything Bagel Lox Brunch Pizza
recipes.description: I took my favorite brunch flavors and put them all on this pizza! An everything bagel layered with smoked salmon, briny capers, herby cheese and tangy pickled onions makes pure magic. It’s a good way to feed a crowd.

recipes.title: Falafel
recipes.description: This authentic falafel recipe uses dried beans that are simply soaked

recipes.title: Pumpkin Falafel
recipes.description: Falafel is the ultimate Middle Eastern street food. Pumpkin adds a light sweetness and keeps the patties moist while baking. Top these beauties with a sweet and savory maple tahini sauce. You can serve them sandwich-style, as an appetizer over a bed of greens, or with soup and salad.

recipes.title: Feta Bruschetta
recipes.description: Fun to say and tasty to eat, feta bruschetta is an easy, flavor-packed appetizer with herbs, spices and tangy cheese in every toasted bite.

recipes.title: Feta-Stuffed Kibbeh with Harissa
recipes.description: There are countless versions of this delicious dish throughout the Middle East. This is our adaptation. You can substitute ground beef for the lamb.

recipes.title: Godfather Cocktail
recipes.description: If you love Scotch, you need to try a classic Godfather cocktail.

recipes.title: Green Shakshuka
recipes.description: Silky sauteed greens with garlic and feta are the foundation for this green shakshuka, a reimagined version of the classic North African egg dish. A side of crusty bread is a must.

recipes.title: Grilled Eggplant with Fig, Feta and Walnuts
recipes.description: This recipe checks all the flavor boxes: sweet, savory, spicy and acidic. It can be a vegetarian Mediterranean main dish or side. Add a little prosciutto or a sprinkle of fresh parsley for even more flavor.

recipes.title: Chocolate-Hazelnut Babka Buns
recipes.description: Chocolate-hazelnut babka buns are a bit of a project, but with eight beautifully wrapped brioche buns filled with Nutella, halva and chocolate chips, I’d say they’re more than worth it.

recipes.title: Harissa
recipes.description: You've probably seen this North African ingredient in recipes for hummus, seafood, sauces and more. But if you're wondering, What is harissa? then it's time to learn all about this flavorful chile paste.

recipes.title: Herby Chicken with Apricots and Feta
recipes.description: Mix up your weeknight menu with a flavorful braised chicken dish with Middle Eastern flair. I love to serve it with couscous.

recipes.title: Hetal Vasavada’s Iced Chai
recipes.description:
I grew up watching my Ba (grandmother) brew chai every single day, adjusting the spices by instinct and never measuring a thing. This iced chai is my simpler summer version of her classic recipe, using strong CTC tea, crushed cardamom and cinnamon. CTC tea stands for Crush, Tear, Curl, a method that turns black tea leaves into tiny granules of tea. It brews quickly and delivers a strong, tannic flavor that’s the backbone of authentic Indian chai. Leave your expensive whole tea leaves for another day: If you’re making chai, you have to use CTC tea. Lipton's black tea is a good option.

To make this chai as traditional as possible, I prefer a higher ratio of milk to water. It creates a richer chai with tons of body. Unlike the weak, sugary chai you’ll find at many cafes, this one is bold, creamy and deeply spiced

recipes.title: Hetal Vasavada’s Matchai Tiramisu
recipes.description: This matcha and chai (matchai!) tiramisu blends the earthy bitterness of matcha with the warm, spiced comfort of chai. The tiramisu is layered into coupe glasses, so it’s the perfect no-bake dessert that feels fancy but comes together without a fuss.

recipes.title: Air-Fryer Churros
recipes.description: Our air-fryer churro recipe is made for those wanting the sweet treat without all the oil or messy cleanup. Skip the frying!

recipes.title: Homemade Chili Crisp
recipes.description: With just a few minutes of cooking and a handful of pantry ingredients, you can make a spicy, crunchy homemade chili crisp to spoon over everything.

recipes.title: Gefilte Fish
recipes.description: This is not your bubbe's gefilte fish! Our step-by-step homemade gefilte fish recipe will make you forget that store-bought jar ever existed.

recipes.title: Homemade Gelt
recipes.description: Skip the grocery store gelt! Instead try this quick and easy homemade gelt that will wow all of your Hanukkah guests.

recipes.title: Hot Apricot Chai Cocktail
recipes.description: This lovely wintertime cocktail is a hit with my friends for its rich flavor and easy prep. I like to garnish it with a slice of orange.

recipes.title: Instant Pot Collard Greens
recipes.description: Classic Southern comfort food, made fast. Instant Pot collard greens transform the robust leaves into a silky, tender side studded with smoky bacon and sprinkled with hot sauce.

recipes.title: Instant Pot Cuban Chicken
recipes.description: I just love the flavors of Cuban food. With lots of citrus, garlic, cilantro and spices, it is something I could eat every day. I found I could create the slow-cooked flavor using my pressure cooker, and my family is now eating Cuban food a lot more.

recipes.title: Instant Pot Puerto Rican Pernil
recipes.description: Imagine this: You're sitting on the beach, sun shining, waves crashing and a mojito in your hand when the most wonderful aroma wafts over to you. It's a citrusy, spicy, and mouthwatering pork roast more flavorful than anything you've ever had. Cooking and eating this should remind you of the best parts of island life. It's OK to use fresh-squeezed orange juice, lime juice, or a combination of both instead of grapefruit juice. But please, don't ever make this with bottled juice.

recipes.title: Israeli Malabi with Pomegranate Syrup
recipes.description: This is a very famous, easy-to-make sweet milk pudding from Israel. For this recipe, I learned from a friend, you can use rose syrup instead of pomegranate syrup.

recipes.title: Jamaican Cabbage and Saltfish
recipes.description: This Jamaican cabbage and saltfish recipe is a quick and healthy dish that feels like a slice of home. Perfect for breakfast, lunch or dinner, this low-calorie meal is full of flavor.

recipes.title: Jamaican Oxtail
recipes.description: Jamaican oxtail is a dish that deserves all the love and adoration it gets. Enjoy a perfectly tender and flavorful oxtail experience with this recipe. It may take a few extra hours in the kitchen, but the end result is always delectable. Instead of the beef broth, you can add hot water and slowly cook the oxtails. To deglaze your pot after searing the meat you can opt to use a quarter cup of red wine.

recipes.title: Jerk Chicken
recipes.description: Transport your taste buds to the sunny Caribbean with this easy and flavorful Jamaican jerk chicken recipe.

recipes.title: Jojo Potatoes
recipes.description: Jojo potatoes are coated in a savory blend of spices, then deep-fried until crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside.

recipes.title: Korean Chicken Crunch Wrap
recipes.description: Korean chicken crunch wraps are an everything-but-the-kitchen-sink recipe that takes odds and ends and turns them into something exciting.

recipes.title: Lebanese Street Sandwiches
recipes.description: Arayes are grilled Lebanese-style pitas that are stuffed with a seasoned meat mixture. They're commonly found throughout the food stalls that line the streets of Beirut. If you'd rather not use a grill, they can be baked in the oven or made in a panini press too.

recipes.title: Lucy Wang’s Easy KBBQ
recipes.description: Depending where you live, you may not have access to amazing Korean barbecue restaurants. I grew up in the suburbs of Maryland, and the good Korean spots are in Virginia

recipes.title: Lucy Wang’s Mini Omakase
recipes.description: Omakase, which means trust me, is a Japanese serving style where the customer entrusts the sushi chef to prepare an amazing multi-course menu. The menu isn't written ahead of time, so each bite is a surprise

recipes.title: Lucy Wang’s Rainbow Mochi Rice Krispies
recipes.description: Rainbow mochi Rice Krispies is an Asian-inspired twist on a classic treat. Mochi is made of rice flour, so this whole sheet is gluten-free!

recipes.title: Lucy Wang’s Zongzi
recipes.description: This traditional Chinese dish ties back to a true story of a beloved poet named Qu Yuan who was wrongfully accused of treason. People commemorate him each year on the fifth day of the fifth month on the Lunar calendar (usually toward the end of May or June), with dragon boat festivities and these bamboo leaves stuffed with sticky rice and pork belly. Cook a ton of these in advance and keep them in a zip-top bag in the freezer. Thaw them in the fridge overnight and microwave for two minutes in the leaves, or boil them for 10 to 15 minutes directly from the freezer. You can get the leaves on Amazon. Everything else can be found at a local Asian market like HMart.

recipes.title: Lucy Wang’s Hanami Dango
recipes.description: The Sakura Matsuri, also known as the Cherry Blossom Festival, celebrates the spring season! These squishy treats make adorable drink garnishes and are a great kids' activity (they're basically nontoxic play dough and a lot less messy). If you want to prep them in advance, make the balls but don’t boil them just yet! Sprinkle a little glutinous rice flour on them and freeze them in an airtight container. Boil them right before you plan to serve them.

recipes.title: Macaroni Pie
recipes.description: Barbados-style macaroni pie blends hot sauce, ketchup, mustard, fresh herbs and three types of cheese for a side dish that goes with pretty much everything.

recipes.title: Malfouf
recipes.description: Malfouf, also known as Lebanese cabbage rolls, is a delicacy in the Middle East. Not only are cabbage rolls delicious, but they dress up any table with their beautiful presentation.

recipes.title: Matzo Balls
recipes.description: This matzo ball recipe will teach you how to make this essential Passover food. We make our matzo balls from scratch with a few simple ingredients, including baking powder and seltzer, to create a light and airy texture.

recipes.title: Matzo Brei
recipes.description: Matzo brei, or eggs fried with matzo, is a less-well-known but still classic Passover dish that you'll want to have for breakfast all year long.

recipes.title: Moroccan Apricot Chicken
recipes.description: Chili sauce, apricots and Moroccan seasoning create an incredible sauce for slow-cooked chicken thighs. Traditional Moroccan apricot chicken typically includes chili pepper paste, but I use chili sauce in my version.

recipes.title: Moroccan-Spiced Chicken Sliders
recipes.description: This recipe is great for both fast and easy weeknight dinners and for entertaining! Ras el hanout is a mixture of ground spices that typically includes various peppers, cardamom, ginger, cinnamon, nutmeg, turmeric and mace. It can be found in the spice section of well-stocked supermarkets. For a more peppery slider, substitute baby arugula for the leaf lettuce.

recipes.title: Mother’s Day Ham
recipes.description: After one bite, my husband informed me this slow-cooker ham was the best I've ever made. I invented it because I’m always buying international condiments and finding ways to use them. Sumac is the secret ingredient here.

recipes.title: Mozzarella Sticks
recipes.description: Golden, gooey and perfectly seasoned, these homemade mozzarella sticks are fail-proof. You'll fall in love with this recipe.

recipes.title: Feijoada
recipes.description: Feijoada is a delicious black bean stew that's Brazil's national dish. We make our feijoada recipe in the slow cooker with four kinds of meat and lots of tender black beans.

recipes.title: Nana Reba's Potato Knishes
recipes.description: I grew up eating these potato knishes every holiday. My grandmother had to show up with at least four dozen because they were devoured within minutes! I haven't changed her recipe other than to use ready-made pie crusts. You can use cooked ground beef or lamb as well.

recipes.title: Oaxacan Coffee
recipes.description: Fans of tequila, Scotch whisky or Irish coffee will smack their lips when you serve them a warm, mezcal-spiked Oaxacan coffee.

recipes.title: Orange Apricot Couscous Chicken
recipes.description: I love the bright flavors in this recipe. The orange juice, curry powder, feta and mint really jazz up the rest of the ingredients! Once the ingredients are assembled, this recipe comes together in no time. If you like, you can use large cubed peaches or nectarines instead of apricots.

recipes.title: Pacoca
recipes.description: Pacoca (Brazilian peanut candy) is an easy treat that has only five ingredients! It's a popular sweet in Brazil, and after you try it, I'm sure you'll love it, too.

recipes.title: Pan de Jamon
recipes.description: Pan de jamon isn't just for Christmas

recipes.title: Passion Fruit Margarita
recipes.description: One sip of this passion fruit margarita will transport you to a tropical island. You don't need to leave home to feel as if you're on vacation!

recipes.title: Peach Bellini
recipes.description: This peach Bellini recipe makes hosting your next brunch a breeze. The gorgeous simplicity of homemade peach syrup and your favorite prosecco create a classic cocktail that starts the party right.

recipes.title: Pickle Canoes
recipes.description: I came up with this recipe when I was looking for a snack in my grandparents' fridge and saw these ingredients. Everyone in my family wanted to try my creation and said it was amazing.

recipes.title: Pink Pina Colada
recipes.description: Break out your blender and find some tiny umbrellas! This pink pina colada recipe provides a taste of the tropics that will get any summer celebration started.

recipes.title: Pisco Sour
recipes.description: Made with South American brandy, the pisco sour has a silky texture and tart, earthy flavor.

recipes.title: Planter’s Punch
recipes.description: If you like your Planter's Punch on the sweet side, add a splash of simple syrup to the shaker. A dash or two of bitters is sometimes added to this classic tropical cocktail.

recipes.title: Pomegranate Margarita
recipes.description: In cold weather months, a pomegranate margarita is the perfect drink. It brings tropical flavors to a classic cocktail

recipes.title: Potato Quesadillas
recipes.description: I made potato-rolled tacos all the time and wanted to switch it up, so I started making quesadillas out of my original recipe. I serve the creamy, crispy potato quesadillas with salsa and sour cream. For an extra surprise, serve homemade guacamole, too.

recipes.title: Rice Kheer
recipes.description: This delicately spiced and velvety smooth kheer recipe is made with simple pantry staples, and is great warmed or chilled.

recipes.title: Rose Water Rice Pudding
recipes.description: This rice pudding is a popular Middle Eastern treat. Pomegranate seeds and chopped pistachios add a simple yet elegant touch to this floral Lebanese specialty.

recipes.title: Rum Runner
recipes.description: One sip of a rum runner drink can trick you into thinking you’re enjoying an island paradise, especially if a colorful paper umbrella is involved.

recipes.title: Sausage and Bean Skillet with Crispy Plantains
recipes.description: I love a quick weeknight dinner, especially when the whole family loves it. This dish has tasty Caribbean flavors, and the plantain chips on top are a big hit. We love this with smoked sausage, but it's also delicious with spicy chicken sausage.

recipes.title: Sephardic Charoset
recipes.description: This Sephardic charoset is perfect for your Passover table and to have on hand throughout the week.

recipes.title: Sheet-Pan Chicken Curry Dinner
recipes.description: This sheet-pan chicken curry is a quick way to get a meal on the table without fuss. Everyone loves it, and it's healthy to boot! Serve it with a side of jasmine rice.

recipes.title: Skinny Margarita
recipes.description: This skinny margarita has plenty of fresh flavors with fewer calories. The lighter version of this classic cocktail skips the sugar and instead focuses on natural ingredients like lime and orange juice for its sweet taste.

recipes.title: Spicy Cantaloupe Bites
recipes.description: Juicy melon, tangy sauce and assorted peppers come together to create a sweet and spicy tidbit. Combine these peppered melon balls with plain melon for a refreshing salad.

recipes.title: Spinach and Feta Bourekas
recipes.description: These pastries are light and soft with a bit of crunch, and are one of my favorite appetizers for holidays. They can be filled with almost anything, but spinach and feta are my go-to fillings. Topped with everything seasoning, these little triangles are out of this world.

recipes.title: Spinach Frittata
recipes.description: Think of this spinach frittata

recipes.title: Squash Focaccia
recipes.description: This squash focaccia is a seasonal twist on the classic Italian bread. Layered with fall flavors, the easy-to-make bread is ideal for holiday spreads or cozy weeknight meals.

recipes.title: Steak Alfredo
recipes.description: Steak Alfredo pairs a juicy seared steak with rich and creamy pasta, putting a decadent twist on a classic. Add a crisp salad, and dinner is ready.

recipes.title: Sticky Toffee Pudding for Two
recipes.description: Make date night at home even more special by plating up sticky toffee pudding for two with homemade toffee sauce.

recipes.title: Strawberry Mojito
recipes.description: Make a fruity strawberry mojito with only a handful of fresh ingredients (and no special tools).

recipes.title: Sun-Dried Tomato Pesto
recipes.description: Sun-dried tomato pesto skips the basil and leans into the sweet and umami notes of oil-packed sun-dried tomatoes.

recipes.title: Sweet Potato Curry
recipes.description: This easy vegan sweet potato curry is a soul-filling meal that won't break the bank. To make it even heartier add extra vegetables, chickpeas or even meat.

recipes.title: Sweet Potato Latkes
recipes.description: I have great memories of making this recipe for family holidays. Shredded russet potatoes can be used instead of sweet for a change of pace. Serve these with sour cream, applesauce or a sprinkling of chopped chives.

recipes.title: Sweet Potato Tots
recipes.description: Air-fried sweet potato tots are a colorful, healthy snack or side that's crispy on the outside and tender on the inside.

recipes.title: Rum Punch
recipes.description: Nothing says "I'm on vacation" like a refreshing rum punch recipe. Here's how to make rum punch the classic way.

recipes.title: Syrian Green Beans with Fresh Herbs
recipes.description: This how my mom always made green beans. She got the recipe from a neighbor when we lived in Turkey. Make a double batch, as they make an excellent healthy snack straight from the fridge. Add a thinly sliced onion and red bell pepper if you like. You can also make them ahead and add to a salad.

recipes.title: Tahini Brownies
recipes.description: If you’ve never baked with tahini or halva before, these tahini brownies are a great introduction.

recipes.title: Tam To’s Char Siu Potato Balls
recipes.description: These char siu potato balls combine the best of two iconic favorites: the sweet and savory flavor of Chinese char siu barbecue pork with crispy Porto’s potato balls. Inspired by the famous Southern California bakery, this fusion recipe blends a tender meat filling with a crispy outer golden texture. The potato balls can be made in the air fryer, plus they’re freezer-friendly and guaranteed to be a favorite at gatherings.

recipes.title: Tam To’s Vietnamese Coffee Jelly
recipes.description: There's no better way to enjoy a normal cup of coffee than by turning it into jelly! Vietnamese coffee is known to be strong and is typically served as a light dessert, but it can be served in any shape or form. This unique spin turns it into Vietnamese coffee jelly with a drizzle of condensed milk on top.

recipes.title: Tyler Smith’s Cheesy Italian Shells
recipes.description: I'm taking you back in time with these classic cheesy, saucy shells. This updated version is bursting with flavor, thanks to a creamy vodka sauce packed with sirloin and Italian sausage.

recipes.title: Tzatziki
recipes.description: This herby cucumber-yogurt sauce tastes great on everything. Use our tzatziki recipe as a dip for chips and vegetables, as a condiment for sandwiches and wraps, or as a cool, refreshing sauce to liven up grilled meats and vegetables.

recipes.title: Watermelon Mojito
recipes.description: The classic mojito gets a refreshing upgrade with freshly-muddled watermelon.

recipes.title: Yuca Frita con Mojo
recipes.description: Who doesn’t love something fried? That’s how I first got turned on to yuca, and now I cook it regularly. It is a starchy tuber, similar in texture to a potato, and is served with a lovely garlicky orange dipping sauce.

recipes.title: Authentic Chimichurri (Uruguay & Argentina)
recipes.description: Authentic Chimichurri from Uruguay & Argentina is the best accompaniment to any barbecued or grilled meats! Also used to serve as a dressing on salads.

recipes.title: Crispy Black Bean Sweet Potato Enchiladas
recipes.description: Crunchy, saucy, spicy and cheesy! These enchiladas come together easily and are so delicious!

recipes.title: Basil Ranch Chicken and Bacon Quesadilla with Avocado
recipes.description: The perfect cheesy quesadillas to enjoy for lunch or dinner!

recipes.title: One Skillet Street Corn Chicken Enchilada Bake
recipes.description: A delicious twist on the combo of baked enchiladas and street corn that everyone will love!

recipes.title: Chicken Quesadillas with Creamy Chipotle Sauce
recipes.description: Made with leftover or store-bought rotisserie chicken...simple to make and so delicious!

recipes.title: Sheet Pan Chipotle Cheddar Corn Chicken Enchiladas
recipes.description: The perfect weeknight meal made entirely on one sheet pan in less than an hour...your own little fiesta!

recipes.title: Weeknight Cheesy Baked Chipotle Chicken Tacos with Cilantro Lime Ranch.
recipes.description: Crunchy on the outside...spicy and cheesy inside. Serve each taco with a creamy, cooling cilantro lime ranch sauce, and a mix of your favorite taco toppings.

recipes.title: Spicy Chipotle Honey Salmon Bowls
recipes.description: Colorful and fresh, these bowls may seem involved but they're actually simple to make and full of so much flavor!

recipes.title: Crispy Carnitas Tacos with Roasted Jalapeño Lime Avocado
recipes.description: These tacos come together easily. They're slightly spicy, so cheesy, and so yummy!

recipes.title: Baked Cheesy Cuban Chicken Taquitos
recipes.description: Baked on a sheet pan until crispy...a delicious twist on a Mexican favorite with a bit of Cuban flavor!

recipes.title: One Skillet Cheesy Green Chile Chicken
recipes.description: Simple One Skillet Cheesy Green Chile Chicken: delicious saucy cheesy chicken that's all made in one pan, is no fuss, and is so quick and easy!

recipes.title: Sheet Pan Crispy Chicken Tacos with Roasted Jalapeño Sesame Verde
recipes.description: Perfectly seasoned chicken with a sauce that really completes it...easy and so delicious!

recipes.title: Sheet Pan Jalapeño Pineapple Shrimp Tacos with Cilantro Garlic Sauce
recipes.description: All made on just one sheet pan and in under 30 minutes!

recipes.title: Sheet Pan Poblano Chicken Fajita Bowls
recipes.description: These colorful chicken bowls are a simple delicious dinner - and made in under 45 minutes!

recipes.title: Skillet Chicken Fajitas with Creamy Jalapeño Verde Sauce.
recipes.description: Fresh, colorful, and tastes even better...it's that sauce, different but so delicious!

recipes.title: Sheet Pan Street Style Steak Tacos
recipes.description: These come together easily and are so delicious—smoky and spicy—even better than street tacos!

recipes.title: Chipotle pork and pineapple skewers
recipes.description: Inspired by the al pastor pork dish of central Mexico (see Know-how, below), this skewered version is a fab thing to throw on the barbecue. The fresh pineapple helps to tenderise the pork, which is given a smoky heat from the chipotle in the marinade. Discover more barbecue recipes from around the world.

recipes.title: Crispy Parma Ham breakfast tacos
recipes.description: Swap out your usual breakfast for these light and flavourful tacos filled with coriander and spring onion folded eggs, crispy Parma Ham, a touch of crumbled feta and, if you like it spicy, a fiery whack of hot sauce. Easy and exciting: Swap bacon for flavour-packed Parma Ham to add some interest to your breakfast; we’ve lightly fried it for a satisfying crispy texture.  Produced exclusively in Parma from Italian pork legs, this special ingredient is made without additives and also lends it

recipes.title: Elotes (Mexican-style street corn)
recipes.description: Corn on the cob is the sweet taste of summer – and these Mexican-style snacks take things to a different level with a zingy cheesy topping. Grilled corn on the cob slathered in mayo and cheese is sold from food carts across Mexico, but it’s just as good in your back garden… The mayonnaise is spiked with lime, garlic, coriander and spring onions, and we’ve replaced hard-to-find Mexican cheese, cotija, with a punchy mixture of feta and parmesan. We’ve used the sweetcorn husks to make pretty

recipes.title: Fish schnitzel with chipotle mayonnaise, pico de gallo and candied jalapeños
recipes.description: If you love a fish taco, you’ll love this Mexican-inspired schnitzel. Serve with creamy chipotle mayo, zesty pico de gallo and sweet-spicy pops of candied jalapeños. For a delicious vegetarian alternative, check out our aubergine parmigiana schnitzel recipe.

recipes.title: Smoky pork shoulder tacos
recipes.description: Tenderised with orange and pineapple juice, and flavoured with smoky chipotle and aromatics, this pork shoulder will shred apart. Pile it onto tacos alongside pickled onions, pico de gallo and hot sauce. This type of low-and-slow barbecuing is taken very seriously in the US, and can become a deep rabbit hole of science and technique. We’ve kept the recipe simple, but it’s worth exploring further online if you like the results. Discover more brilliant barbecue recipes.

recipes.title: Cóctel de Camaron
recipes.description: Cóctel de Camarón is a Mexican shrimp cocktail that combines juicy shrimp, a tangy tomato sauce, and a mix of fresh ingredients!

recipes.title: Easy Chicken Enchiladas
recipes.description: These Easy Chicken Enchiladas make the best Mexican dinner! They're stuffed with shredded chicken and cheese, topped with red enchilada sauce and baked.

recipes.title: Chicken Enchiladas
recipes.description: My all-time favorite chicken enchilada recipe! See notes above for possible ingredient variations.

recipes.title: Anticuchos de Corazon, Grilled Heart Skewers
recipes.description: This is a versatile recipe that works with more than just hearts. Any meat you want to eat on a skewer will do, including shrimp and lobster.

recipes.title: Peruvian Anticuchos de carne
recipes.description: A classic Peruvian recipe.

recipes.title: Anticuchos de carne (Peruvian marinated beef skewers)
recipes.description: Anticuchos are meat skewers marinated in an easy chili-based marinade - packed with flavor!

recipes.title: Peruvian Anticuchos Recipe
recipes.description: Peruvian Anticuchos (Grilled Skewers) are incredibly popular throughout Peru and South American countries. Not meant to be the main course, these tasty skewers are served as a side dish along with other dishes such as choripanes, potatoes, sausages, or salad.
